title: How to Add Dimples to JPG Images with MS Paint

steps.headline: Take a screenshot with whatever program you need.
steps.description: Use whatever program you have and SAVE your work as a file. You can also upload and save your pictures from your digital camera to your PC.

steps.headline: Click "My Computer" and find your picture in whatever folder you saved your file in.
Right-click the icon to the file.
Left-click the "Edit" choice.
steps.description: It should bring up your Paint program. Use Paint to paint lines onto the file.

steps.headline: Make some revisions on your work.
steps.description: Add lines to certain items or add text or both or, do something with the image to make it different from the original work.

steps.headline: Save your work again.
steps.description: Click the "File" menu option then click "Save" (not "Save As") unless you want to create a differently copied file. This is vital to improve your image.

tyn: JPEG image (JPG) of any sort (could even be a screenshot)
text: Take a screenshot with whatever program you need. Use whatever program you have and SAVE your work as a file. You can also upload and save your pictures from your digital camera to your PC. Click "My Computer" and find your picture in whatever folder you saved your file in.  Right-click the icon to the file.  Left-click the "Edit" choice. It should bring up your Paint program. Use Paint to paint lines onto the file. Make some revisions on your work. Add lines to certain items or add text or both or, do something with the image to make it different from the original work. Save your work again. Click the "File" menu option then click "Save" (not "Save As") unless you want to create a differently copied file. This is vital to improve your image.
sentences: Take a screenshot with whatever program you need.
Use whatever program you have and SAVE your work as a file.
You can also upload and save your pictures from your digital camera to your PC.
Click "My Computer" and find your picture in whatever folder you saved your file in.
Right-click the icon to the file.
It should bring up your Paint program.
Use Paint to paint lines onto the file.
Make some revisions on your work.
Add lines to certain items or add text or both or, do something with the image to make it different from the original work.
Click the "File" menu option then click "Save" (not "Save As") unless you want to create a differently copied file.
This is vital to improve your image.
